website_summaries.verdict: For mulching smaller piles of leaves, this electric mulcher is adequate. Purchase a heavier-gauge trimmer line to beef up its mulching ability.
pros: Very easy to put together, lightweight and portable
Various brands of replacement trimming line will fit this mulcher, and are easy to install and adjust
cons: Handles leaves, but not much else
Legs are a little too short to accommodate standard yard waste bags

customer_reviews.title: Shreds!
customer_reviews.text: It really shreds! Shredded about 7 homedepot bags of leaves and grass down to less than 1. This thing has plenty of power to cut through wet grass and leaves. Mulched almost all of my flower beds with the finely shredded product. Nice to never have to buy homedepot bags and lug them to the street again. I wish I discovered this product earlier. I think the ratio they claim is accuarate. Looking forward to use it again next weekend.
customer_reviews.author: Jon

customer_reviews.title: This is the best piece of equipment for the money I have found ...
customer_reviews.text: This is the best piece of equipment for the money I have found for mulching and bagging leaves. I set it up for the first time today. It is sturdy, well engineered and goes together easily. I have used portable leaf blower/mulchers in the past and they clog up easily and then you have to empty the bag into a lawn bag which is a hassle. From the attached photo you can see that a 39 gallon lawn bag easily attaches to the stand and when you drop leaves into the top of the WORX WG-430, the mulched leaves drop right into the lawn bag saving much work. I highly recommend the WORX WG-430.
customer_reviews.author: Dave Steensland

customer_reviews.title: It's a beast!
customer_reviews.text: This thing will shred leaves really well. What I did was- I replaced the line that came with it with higher quality twister trimmer line from Home Depot (I did not bore the holes bigger like some reviews- I just used yellow twist line that was the same diameter). Now small sticks do not break the line like before. This will also work with wet leaves. The upside is that it makes less 'dust' floating into the air when you trim. The downside is that it gets clogged more often, and you have to stop and clear it out more. Do not use this machine without googles. Things fly out of it.
customer_reviews.author: VemTek

customer_reviews.title: It works well enough, but beware of the annoying shortcomings
customer_reviews.text: Overall this is an acceptable device with a couple of annoying flaws. First, there’s the obvious flaw that the line used for shredding is too thin. Like many people I bought thicker line and modified mine to accept it. Second, it’s a perfectly awkward height for the paper lawn bags from your local big box retailer. Third, it’s easy enough to assemble but the legs feel quite cheap. I managed to somehow get one of my legs permanently jammed in there. But then there’s the good side - when this thing is working and you’re feeding it almost exclusively leaves you’ll end up with a fine mulch that will quickly compost or is easily usable around the yard.
customer_reviews.author: P. Wagstrom

customer_reviews.title: Good for leaves only....no cones or sticks!
customer_reviews.text: Be sure to avoid any small sticks or pine cones....they just shred the string cutters. TIP - If you can substitute some heavier duty cutting strings, do so. The stock strings are weak and don’t last long. The machine works like an upside down weed eater......there is a spinning motor head with two fixed cutting cords/strings....that grind up the leaves. As mentioned, the stock that is supplied as replacements...is of poor quality. You can get the approximate same size diameter String, but much stronger for a conventional string trimmer. otherwise....the machine is pretty good and works well...if set up right.
customer_reviews.author: Paul Harris

customer_reviews.title: It doesn't work properly yet
customer_reviews.text: great idea the strings to cut leaves to much left behind the strings wear out way to fast 3 small containers. I'm going to change string to lightweight cables to get more life from machine. The price is right and the concept is good. I abandoned cable stayed with string sent, but that still doesn't work they tangled up immediately a new method of holding string down as well as a proper cutter. I think maybe returning it would be best .
customer_reviews.author: jim

customer_reviews.title: Great device and entertaining
customer_reviews.text: I've used it 2x and it does a rather fantastic job. And if you can position it like we did in the photo where you can rake or blow the leaves in then that's even better. Seem to be built well but I'll update this after 2 seasons. Running them over with a lawn mower seems more effective however. The price for the unit likes to jump though. Don't pay more than $129 for it. If it's higher than that, just wait a few days.
customer_reviews.author: BoardyGamer

customer_reviews.title: Look before you leap
customer_reviews.text: What a piece of junk.The first day the plastic bolt that holds the cuter head broke.I was able to extract it and use a steel bolt.The second day the cuter head striped its inside plastic nut.I then went to buy a new cuter head and to my surprise that part is no longer available FOR A BRAND NEW MACHINE.This company is a disgrace to the industry and should not sold by Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: Donna

customer_reviews.title: Holds plastic bags for you, no mess
customer_reviews.text: It worked well and I am especially happy because I could use 30 gallon plastic bags under it. Put them on the grid roll them down and put the unit on top. Easy cleanup. Not quite 5 stars only because one of the clips broke on the first use. (There are 4 f them). Its not fatal, it is plenty sturdy without it and I probably will be able to use it next time. The clip is just not permanently attached anymore. But, the unit is just as easy to use as bagging except you have fewer bags when you are done. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Nicholas Cordone

customer_reviews.title: No problems at all.
customer_reviews.text: It says 11:1 but it feels more like 14:1 which is great. Just turns smaller dry leaves into leaf dust. But it also nicely mulches even large thick and wet leaves. There are a lot of trees in my year -about .5acre-and this took care of all the leaves. The strings are extremely easy to replace when they get worn. If the leaves start getting stuck up under the funnel from the air flow...swap out the strings when they start to get worn out. 5 Stars. If i can get 3 seasons out of it, I’ll consider it money well spent.
customer_reviews.author: Nic

customer_reviews.title: Replacement Line has this thing Shredding like a Beast
customer_reviews.text: I would have initially rated this at four stars due to the need to change the trimmer line fairly often. I have small twigs and dried seed pods from locust trees mixed in with my leaves, and they are very hard on the line and shorten it rather quickly. This slows the shredding rate down considerably. After reading other reviews and running out of the line that came with the unit (lasted 2 yrs), I replaced the trimmer line with a stouter version, available from Amazon:  This thing now shreds like a beast, and the stronger line lasts about three times as long as the line that came with the unit.
customer_reviews.author: The Dirt Guy

customer_reviews.title: Better for large leaves
customer_reviews.text: This shredder didn't work at all for me because I have mostly small oak leaves. I was trying to shred them to use for compost, but probably half were not shredded at all, and they take forever to compost. The machine is unbelievably dirty to use -- as was expected -- but even with a mask it was difficult. I'm sure with bigger leaves you would get a better result, but my leaves were only reduced about 2 to 1. Also, many sticks went through whole which I had to pick out by hand.
customer_reviews.author: Pat N

customer_reviews.title: Worx Great!
customer_reviews.text: I've used this mulcher for the last two years, mulching piles and piles of leaves into fine leaf matter to go back into my flower beds. Thick leathery oak leaves, occasional acorn or hickory nut, small twigs - no problem! Dry leaves mulch quicker, with less clogging than damp leaves but even these aren't a big issue if you take your time and watch what you are doing. I upgraded the trimmer line per recommendation of another reviewer to the Echo Black Diamond 330095071 .105 inch line and it seems to last longer.
customer_reviews.author: NE Shopper

customer_reviews.title: Did not work from day one.
customer_reviews.text: Tried to use it a few weeks after I received it. It started and as soon as I dropped a handful of leaves into it it shut off, having tripped a 15 amp circuit breaker. This happened twice more on different outlets. Today I had time to try it out again, only this time it would not come on at all. I tried four different outlets incuding one in my kitchen with the same results. I tested my extension cord with other tools in my garage and they worked normaly. Not a good start after hearing the lauds on a YouTube demonstration.
customer_reviews.author: Joe Noonan

customer_reviews.title: Work's well
customer_reviews.text: Sets up easy and does a good job shredding. Some of my leaves were wet on the surface form the morning dew and they still shredded nicely. I had to clear it out now and then, but as long as I didn't overload it, it didn't get clogged. The rest of my leaves were dry and they shredded without clogging. It really does reduce the volume of leaves and they are perfect for composting, which is what I'm using it for. I didn't use the stand though. I set mine on top of a 20 Gal plastic garbage can, which fit it perfectly. It keeps the dust down and holds a lot of leaves.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: What a piece of junk!
customer_reviews.text: Do not buy this product. It does not go together well AT ALL. The little buttons that are supposed to lock the legs came crushed in an cannot be extracted. You CANNOT use paper bags with it. The paper bag "support" simply falls in. The top of the funnel will only lock in on one side, rendering it useless. Leaves spit out all around the unit. I did about 10 small handfuls of leaves and the line is almost gone already. It sounds like a helicopter landing. An annoyingly high pitched helicopter. You are much better off using your lawn mower and a leaf blower to mulch. This thing is crap.
customer_reviews.author: Marylin M. Butorac

customer_reviews.title: Best thing I bought all year
customer_reviews.text: Best thing I bought all year. Turned my monstrous yard with dozens of leaf-bearing trees into about 2 hours work shredding into 10 leaf-bags. Just like that, all done for the winter. IF the little shredding line lasted longer, I'd have given this 5 stars. I did wear out 3 sets of them and most of a 4th in my 2 hours work. I see in other reviews you don't have to reorder the 'recommended' replacement line, but can use .080 or .090 line that has 4 edges instead of round, for better durability and better cutting, so i'll have that ready for next year. Better yet, Bass Guitar 'A' string in .080 !! Seriously, EXCEEDED my expectations.
customer_reviews.author: Dean Lancaster

customer_reviews.title: So far so good...
customer_reviews.text: We just got this recently and have used it once. It worked well for leafy material. That is, I believe, what they say it us for others have commented that it didn't chew up branches and twigs well or that it hammed up in those cases. I think it's really meant to handle leaf debris. Now of course as we use this more if we have issues, we will update the review but as of now after using it for a reasonable period of time over one afternoon we were satisfied for the price and size.
customer_reviews.author: AMBuyer

customer_reviews.title: Leaves yes, pine needles not so much
customer_reviews.text: Works well on leaves. The volume reduction is about 2/3 on a single pass. I didn't bother to do multiple passes to get the 90% reduction claimed but the manufacturer. Pine needles are another story. Mulching eastern white pine needles(5" long or so) isn't very effective. One pass yielded a 1/3 volume reduction and a lot of dust. The pine needles also seem to wear down the trimmer line much faster than leaves. The trimmer string provided by the manufacturer is fairly soft and wears quickly. I got tougher trimmer string of the same diameter to reduce downtime.
customer_reviews.author: Nate Sheehy

customer_reviews.title: What an amazing machine
customer_reviews.text: This leaf muncher makes short work of my leaves. I have created very large mounds of leaf mulch with this machine. Shortly after purchasing this Mulcher, I went online and read some blogs about replacing the string cutters with better quality strings. I also removed the string cutter inside the machine and lengthened the strings to nearly the diameter of the unit. Those modification turned this mulcher into a Monster Mulcher. As fast as I can load the leaves in (without choking the machine) it grinds and spits them out in seconds. I have mulched leaves for over 40 hours this year. Works perfect. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Greg Nicholson

customer_reviews.title: Do not understand negative reviews
customer_reviews.text: The leaves in the picture were placed in one 37 gallon trash bag. A leaf is a leaf unless it is wet. This machine is amazing and one of the best purchases I have made. It does exactly what it says it will do. I ground up leaves for 2 days and never had to replace the line but I did anyway just to see how difficult it was, piece of cake!!!! I wonder about someone's agenda when they write a negative review on something of this caliber.
customer_reviews.author: NevaDan

customer_reviews.title: Great machine
customer_reviews.text: What a great machine. It blasts leaves into a fine mulch. Even wet leaves it tears up. Sets up in minutes without any tools. All you need is an extension cord. It’s quite loud. Definitely wear ear, eye and dust protection. It makes some dust. Very happy with it. I blitzed a very large quantity of leaves into fine mulch, which I added to my garden soil to compost over winter. If you get a lot of leaves and have a garden, this machine is for you. Why remove all that great organic matter when you can mulch it and return it to the soil?
customer_reviews.author: Mr. Meeseeks

customer_reviews.title: It WorkX!
customer_reviews.text: This thing worked great! Made short work of a ton of leaves. They were pretty much dry a d I have to say, it did amazing work. It is fairly loud, hearing protection is a must and maybe even safety glasses. I'm also not sure on the 11:1 bag ratio that is says it has. I'd guess more like 6 to 1 or so. But that's still good for me. It came with multiple line replacements also which I was curious about. Overall, this item is a big time saver and I highly recommend it if you have a lot of leaves.
customer_reviews.author: Rob

customer_reviews.title: A SOLID VALUE
customer_reviews.text: I BOUGHT MY MACHINE 30 DAYS AGO, AND I ENJOY IT. HAVE MADE OVER 100 GALLONS OF LEAVES FROM COMPOST AND MULCH SOME THOUGHTS: 1. DONT USE IT FOR CUTTING TWIGS--LEAVES ONLY 2. GO SLOW-AND ADD ONLY HANDFULS AT A TIME-GO EVEN SLOWER WITH WET LEAVES 3. IT IS EASY TO CHANGE THE THE CUTTING STRINGS-NICELY ENGINEERED 4. IT IS EASIER TO USE PLASTIC BAGS AS PAPER BAGS ARE A NUISANCE AND TIME CONSUMING TO USE 5. I'M A GARDENER, AND IT IS THE RIGHT MACHINE AND PRICE FOR MAKING COMPOST/MULCH 6. IF YOU CAN LIVE WITH THE FACT THAT IT ISN'T A HIGH POWERED COMMERCIAL CHIPPER I'D SUGGEST BUYING ONE Bruce Forrest
customer_reviews.author: William Forrest

customer_reviews.title: Such a time saver, works very well
customer_reviews.text: Works very well and is much faster than using a vacuum style Mulcher, sets up easy compacts down for storage well. I mainly mulched water oak leaves and they weren’t completely dry and I think it performed very well. It definitely does not mulch down to 11-1 but it does a very good job. If you don’t over load the hopper it mulches much finer. It’s really easy to use with plastic leaf bags. I’m really happy with its performance and it’s truly a time saver. I’m sure it saved me hours over my leaf blower/vacuum unit.
customer_reviews.author: Todd  Smith

customer_reviews.title: Motor burned out.
customer_reviews.text: Very easy to assemble and use. I used it with mixed dry leaves in South Florida. There were no twigs in there, but certain fibrous leaves kept causing the string to break which is annoying. I can see why the string is allowed to break - if you threw something solid in there by mistake, it would be a problem if the string didn't break. My solution was to be careful choosung the types of leaves that I'm mulching. It takes very little time to mulch a large lawn bag of leaves. It's loud and dusty, but that comes with the territory. Update June 2020. For reasons unknown, the motor burned out! Leaves were dry and free of twigs, etc.
customer_reviews.author: MST

customer_reviews.title: Save your bags...and a little of the environment too.
customer_reviews.text: Works fantastic on dry leaves, itty bitty sticks. Works on we leaves too but it is a real mess. I see people complaining about performance but this is a hyperpower weed whacker on a stand, not a billy goat. Use it for what it is intended for and you will be done with the job quick. Using the paper refuse bags didn't work well, but I put a large contractor plastic back on the stand and it will hold a yard full of leaves. Then I dump them out back or where ever I want some organic matter.
customer_reviews.author: S. L. Seamans

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use!
customer_reviews.text: I am not a machine person, but I can easily change the string myself. The stand it comes with is a bit wimpy. My husband cut a piece of plywood to fit inside a barrel. It’s sturdy, contains all the chopped leaves, and is easy to dump. Buy better weed wacker string as that too is wimpy. If leaves aren’t wet, it does clog, but it’s easy to remedy. When dry, it chews through them like nobody’s business! That said, make sure you protect your eyes! Debris shoots everywhere! I wish I had bought this years ago. It’s Already paid for itself with my savings on purchased mulch.
customer_reviews.author: julie wojtkowski

customer_reviews.title: Have a lot of leaves?  Try something else
customer_reviews.text: This may work if you have one or two trees but this is no match for the many leaves I have to deal with. I will say that it does chop up the leaves nicely but takes too long for the amount of leaves I have to deal with. I even keep up with it and don't let them pile up forever but this was just not the magic machine I was looking for. I also have a lot of twigs that get into the leaves and this machine does not do well with twigs. I gave it a three since it does work but just not for large amounts of leaves and twigs.
customer_reviews.author: Jon L

customer_reviews.title: Very good leaf mulcher
customer_reviews.text: This mulcher is great to mulch leaves. There should be a little more horse power, however, it did mulch the leaves to save space in the bag. It is not easy to get around if you have a large yard. I put the leaves in a collapsible bag, then emptied it into the mulcher a little at a time, as it is not fast enough to do a whole bag at once and it is messy. As some of the leaf dust gets out and blows around. However, it does do the trick once you get use to it.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Kemo

customer_reviews.title: Completely Satisfied
customer_reviews.text: We love our Amazon Prime. They built 2 warehouses in SLC recently and it is amazing to me how many of the items we order come the next day, I ordered my WORX leaf mulcher on the 23rd and received it on the 25th. I assembled it in about 5 min and was mulching 10 minutes later. It lived up to all the claims. I worked for about 5 hours and ended up with 7 or 8 mulched bags of leaves. No problems what so ever. I never did have to change the trimmer strings. The only problem is that the wind is now blowing and I'm going to have to do it all over again.
customer_reviews.author: Marcia E. Burris

customer_reviews.title: Didn't work for me
customer_reviews.text: I'm glad that others had a better experience with this leaf shredder but it didn't work for me. As someone else remarked, you must carefully sort out any small ( even tiny) twigs from your leaves which is way too time consuming for me. The strings kept breaking or wore down very quickly. The machine is also very high which wouldn't be a deal breaker but it sure is a back-breaker after several loads. I don't know if I could recommend this or not because it seems to be one of those items that pleases just as many as it disappoints. I returned mine after using it one time for about 20 minutes.
customer_reviews.author: LizzieW

customer_reviews.title: very good shredder
customer_reviews.text: this shredder works well. this reduces the leaves to very small size and almost to dust. Once issue is that if the leaves are slightly wet, the machine can get clogged. I just use a stick to keep the leaves from clogging. This slows down the process but still it works well. I also wish the shredding twine was of a heavier gauge. I have had to replace the twine a few times over the period of using this a few hours use. The twine is inexpensive enough that I'm not worrying about this. This is somewhat loud, but not as loud as I thought it would be. Wear ear protection still.
customer_reviews.author: mmmmmmm

customer_reviews.title: Very effective, but you do get messy.
customer_reviews.text: This thing is messy. Definitely wear safety goggles and a mask. But if you have a lot of leaves it’s essential. I rig it to go directly into my compost and trash cans so I don’t have to use bags. Assuming their 11 to 1 ratio is legit I can rake/blow and get 1,300+ gallons of leaves into my bins in about 1.5 hours. Not bag considering I used to have to haul around 20 bags of leaves!
customer_reviews.author: M. McPit

customer_reviews.title: Works OK
customer_reviews.text: After a couple of uses, can report it works OK. As others have noted, performance is much better with dry leaves. In fact, it works great with dry leaves. With wet, not so much. Still mulches, with wet leaves, but we found it necessary to stir the leaves with a stick while they were being processed. The wet mulch doesn't want to fall through into the bag so much. Oh yeah, and it goes through the cutting strings really fast, especially with wet leaves. Fortunately they are pretty easy to replace. Recommend buying a couple of extra sets (at $7 or so for 24).
customer_reviews.author: James G. Gibson

customer_reviews.title: Does what it says!
customer_reviews.text: Read what it says; the material it can handle. If that is followed, the Worx 13 Amp is perfect. Took the leaves in my yard and shredded them in no time...like minutes....like it shredded faster then I could put them in....and I could use the broken leaves for mulch. No more bags to the city road. I saved enough money from not having to buy mulch to pay for the Worx 13 Amp in one season. The plastic strings did not wear out and I will have another season with them. I have one ~60 yo silver maple and one ~90 yo Oak tree to clean up after. Easy to set up, easy to use. Will need some storage space.
customer_reviews.author: Jones

customer_reviews.title: Great product!
customer_reviews.text: We bought this for my father and he LOVES it! He has a large yard with several mature maple and oak trees, so we really put it to the test this past fall. It does great work maple leaves, but struggles a bit with oak leaves. We mulched the leaves with a lawn mower or a leaf mulcher first, then put them thru the shredder. There resulting leaf mulch was really fine and will probably be soil by the time spring comes around (we have lots of hard working worms in our gardens). Pre-mulching the leaves also helps reduce sticks that would otherwise break down the string quickly.
customer_reviews.author: Megan

customer_reviews.title: Mulching was a breeze
customer_reviews.text: This electric leaf mulcher was easy to assemble right out of the box. We were mulching leaves within 10 minutes of removing it from the box. It is easy to replace the line used to mulch the leaves too. We have a big maple tree in the backyard so the yard is covered in leaves each fall. We were able to mulch all the leaves this year which saved us time and space in the yard waste bin. Definitely recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Gizmo

customer_reviews.title: Mulched leaves right into the garden
customer_reviews.text: I mulched leaves directly into the garden. It works quickly. Small sticks were not a problem but larger sticks will shred the nylon whips quickly as indicated in the instructions. I have not tried it with wet leaves and have only processed eight 50 gallon bags of raked leaves so far. I easily replaced the whips once for normal wear and tear. I use hearing protection and a dust mask like I do for all work of this nature. It is a bit noisy.
customer_reviews.author: Isaac Pascal

customer_reviews.title: Great time saving and space saving product. Perfect and super simple to assemble and use.
customer_reviews.text: Simple product which works, love this. I tried the vacuum and cutters before and they are bulky and messy to use. With this I use a pop up trash can like a giant dust pan, sweep the leaves in then dump in this guy and perfect cut leaves every time. So simple to set-up and use. My only advice is wear a mask and eye protection is can get dusty. But that is to be expected with such a machine.
customer_reviews.author: PurpleDuck

customer_reviews.title: Definitely reduced the number of used bags, not good with sticks, line doesn't last long
customer_reviews.text: Overall a pretty positive experience with this product. It does what it claims to do, maybe not the 11:1 ratio, but probably closer to 5:1 (which is still very helpful). The included line is pretty bad, it doesn't do well with even small sticks (at all). I ended up purchasing some 3rd party (stronger) line, it helped a bit, was definitely cheaper than buying the recommended replacement line. This product is durable, easy to move, easy to disassemble and clean, and for a reasonable price!
customer_reviews.author: David Stiles

customer_reviews.title: Dont buy piece if junk
customer_reviews.text: Piece of chit! Keeps stopping having to refill the line every five minutes! Have fun trying to get the fine twigs out of leaves. Then the damn screws in the middle got stuck cant get it out. Sending this back! Its crap. Now I am left bagging a ton of leaves!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Worx electric leaf mulcher performs as advertised
customer_reviews.text: I've never owned or used a leaf mulcher before the Worx 13 Amp Electric Leaf Mulcher. It took about 10-15 minutes to assemble. Despite knowing its dimensions, it seemed bigger than I expected once I had it fully put together. It chops leaves using plastic cords that spin around; the same types of plastic cords used in trimmers. I tested it with a small pile of leaves. It worked fine and seemed to handle the small twigs without problem. It doesn't break down leaves into super fine pieces, but it does the job. I don't know how it will perform over an entire autumn, but so far, so good.
customer_reviews.author: fp shew

customer_reviews.title: Does not work as advertised
customer_reviews.text: I had such high hopes for this device. I started feeding leaves into the hopper and it nearly immediately bridged up and I could not get any leaves down to the shredding element with out stopping it and redistributing the leaves. I cleaned it out and started again with a much small batch of leaves and it still bridged up. I had to resort to using the back of rake to move leaves around just to get them to shred. I returned this the same day.
customer_reviews.author: Steve Wilhelmy

customer_reviews.title: This is so efficient
customer_reviews.text: We always have gas products and I have always been leary of getting something that was electric. I cannot believe how well this mulches up my leaves. They are so chopped that I can mix them in with dirt in making my gardens or put over as a mulch. It is not heavy so I am able to move it and not have to wait for my husband to move it for me. That by itself is worth it, but I am absolutely amazed at how fine of texture this makes them. I have so many leaves and have chopped them up and can't wait until fall to do more!
customer_reviews.author: Colleen

customer_reviews.title: Works very well
customer_reviews.text: Just got this and it works great. The unit overall is light, easy to maneuver. You can place a bag in the stand under the unit, for all of the chopped leaves to fall into. The cutting strings are very easy to replace. It is noisy and dusty, but it sure is easier than putting leaves in a bag and tamping them down all day. Not sure about durability, or how long it will last, but seems reasonably well made.
customer_reviews.author: Dave S

customer_reviews.title: Great too
customer_reviews.text: Great tool to chop up leaves! A little dusty. My husband wore a mask, but I did not. Must feed it slowly or it will clog up. We needed to buy more plastic line that was thicker. The line that comes with it, was too thin. That ran out very quickly. Overall, it’s a wonderful tool to chop up leaves. I used the chopped leaves on all my flower beds as a top dressing over the winter. Excellent!! Would definitely IH this again.
customer_reviews.author: Elaine

customer_reviews.title: The WORX Leaf Mulcher WORKS!
customer_reviews.text: I wish I had bought this earlier! I had purchase a Toro blower/mulcher, and, while it does a good job mulching, it took a lot of effort on my part. The WORX leaf mulcher made the job SO MUCH EASIER! Reduced ~23 large (33-gallon) bags worth of leaves to one green waste barrel plus three bags of mulch. I would definitely recommend this to others. Be sure to wear eye and hearing protection!
customer_reviews.author: Susan K.

customer_reviews.title: If you have a yard you need this machine
customer_reviews.text: Great machine. Saves so much time and effort inputs about 10 or 11 bags worth of leaves into just one. When I first saw this machine I didn't think that it would be as good as it turned out to be. I got my entire yard completely clean of leaves for the first time in years. I did this in about two sessions on two different days. I only had to replace the strings twice. Everything went into about 3 or 4 bags when I normally have to use well over 10. This Worx machine even handled small twigs that got into it accidentally without any problem. After using this I can do nothing but highly recommend this product
customer_reviews.author: Rescue2

customer_reviews.title: Great Product
customer_reviews.text: This definitely works as advertised, but you'll need some big lawn bags to really get stuff done w/o changing them constantly. You can cram about 8-10 normal lawn bags into a single plastic lawn waste-bag. Definitely cuts costs there. The noise level is very high, but it gets the job done. Just beware with wet/damp leaves, they will clog if you put them in too quickly. Dry leaves and debris is ideal to use with this device.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew

customer_reviews.title: Works great with one modification
customer_reviews.text: I used this machine first with the trimmer line supplied in the package, then I installed the .095 trimmer line and it becomes a whole new machine. With the larger line, the machine shreds the leaves in to smaller pieces. The new line does create more debris flying from the machine so be sure to wear safety goggles. The line needs to be replaced every hour of operation or so, super simple to replace and the sooner you replace it, the happier you will be since it just works better with fresh line. Works best with dry leaves of course. But, with the larger line it still handles wet leaves better than with the supplied line.
customer_reviews.author: Tbonewilly

customer_reviews.title: Works well even with damp leaves, but could be bigger
customer_reviews.text: The product works well with dry leaves and also seems to work pretty well with damp leaves. You can't use it with wet leaves. Better string is helpful. I have put up to .115 in it and it helps from the longevity perspective. On the bad side, I really need a bigger unit. I have a half acre of property with giant SE varieties of trees in the 80 to 120 foot range. Bigger would be better. This units is really just to small for a larger property. If they made a jumbo size, I would be really happy.
customer_reviews.author: james hilton

customer_reviews.title: A bit loud but works well.
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely love this thing! I use it to mulch up pine straw and my flowerbeds look so much better now. I mulched up leaves, pine straw and manure for my compost bin. It’s a bit louder than I expected but it gets the job done quick! The string is easy to replace and I’m pretty sure I can find the right size and just use weedeater string for it when I run out of the handful they give you. My husband thought I was crazy and said “Why are you getting that? We have a lawn mower that does the same thing.” After I mulched the backyard he liked how practical it is.
customer_reviews.author: Kozak

customer_reviews.title: I wish it had worked
customer_reviews.text: Great idea but it wears out too soon so you have to constantly change the strings that act as blades. Extremely noisy so my neighbors were furious. Mulch didn't come out as fine as I expected so I had to return it. I wish it had worked though.
customer_reviews.author: Jewel

customer_reviews.title: volume capacity is misleading....
customer_reviews.text: I am enjoying my new WORX leaf mulcher but am disappointed in the actual amount of time it tales to mulch leaves. The 54 gallons per minute is very misleading....I cannot feed leaves in that fast, for one. Too, the cutting line doesn't last long when leaves have stiffer, thicken stems and so slows the mulching process considerably when changing out those worn cutting lines.
customer_reviews.author: Ona B. Welch

customer_reviews.title: No More Doubts
customer_reviews.text: Going into the purchase I was skeptical of any of the mulchers that used string instead of blades. But, given the price differential, I went with the string. I am very pleased with the performance of the Worx. The strings do a great job and, after three days, are not showing much wear. At age 69, I'm glad to no longer be stepping into garbage cans or tromping on bags to compact the leaves.
customer_reviews.author: D. Madsen

customer_reviews.title: Awesome leaf shredding machine - Easy set up
customer_reviews.text: This does a pretty good job of shredding leaves. I would give it a 5 star rating except the shredding string breaks easily if small branches accidentally get mixed in with leaves. The old leaf pile I shredded included some wet leaves. The attached picture shows how well they were chopped up. It really gives my compost a head start. Trash bags stay firmly in place while shredding leaves. Shredding string is easy to replace, can use regular. 90 or .95 trimmer string.
customer_reviews.author: M Simpson

customer_reviews.title: It Worx ohk
customer_reviews.text: The 11:1 ratio they claim must be for leaves with 0% moisture. For me, it's about 4:1. For a string cutting device, it worked better I expected but since I use the shredded leaves for mulching and tilling into soil, I have to run them thru with a 2nd pass thru so they're more finely shredded - I'd like to see them make a dual chamber unit that shreds them twice because it seems 20% of the leaves get through unscathed. Wet-ish leaves will slow you down and you'll have to manually scrape the barrel to get the gunk down in the bag. Twigs are this thing's nemesis...if you deal with twigs, I'd suggest you buy a metal bladed shredder.
customer_reviews.author: numbnerve

customer_reviews.title: A must have for a yard with a lot of leaves
customer_reviews.text: This shredder handles leafs with no problem. Reduced my normal fall bags significantly . Light weight and easy to move around the yard. What this is, is a weed eater turned upside down, clever idea. Easy assembly and disassembly, can be hosed down (sealed motor) when finished and stored for next year. I thought it did a good job mulching the leaves and am really glad someone put the effort into creating this much-needed piece of equipment and offer it at a reasonable price.
customer_reviews.author: Bradley.s.Philipson

customer_reviews.title: Better than expected!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this, knowing that if dissatisfied, we could return it. However, the thing works quite well! Made five 39 gallon trash bags of chopped up leaves yesterday. Used with the Tabor Tools leaf scoops; which was great. I didn't baby the mulcher, even did some small twigs mixed in with the leaves. I like the string-trimmer style chopping mechanism. Big scoops of dried leaves did not present a problem, and I could also use the scoops to help tap the leaves into the mulcher without worrying about fingers. Pleasantly surprised with this device!
customer_reviews.author: G. Wooten

customer_reviews.title: Good for dry leaves
customer_reviews.text: The first time I used it was with dry leaves. It worked great. I did not change the string and filled 4 bags. The second time was with wet leaves. Not so good. I would have to stop, turn it off and push the mulched leaves through the holes into the bag. So if you think you can mulch all of your leaves when they are dry then buy it. When leaves are wet it is a waist of time.
customer_reviews.author: abcde

customer_reviews.title: Yes, exactly what I needed!
customer_reviews.text: After 2 different hand held leaf mulchers that clogged all the time this thing worked like a charm. The leaves were finely ground and I hope they will be usable compost by next spring. The assembly was quick and painless and I reduced a large pile of leaves to less than 2 paper lawn bags. This would be my only complaint have something to shred the leaves into, I ripped a paper lawn bag but Amazon has some reusable lawn bags that will work but I wish it came with a reusable bag.
customer_reviews.author: CMiskie

customer_reviews.title: I found this shredder very easy to assemble and use
customer_reviews.text: I found this shredder very easy to assemble and use. I have used it once to shred the small tough leaves from a live oak and I found it very easy to operate. Yes it is loud, but wearing hearing protection took care of the noise and yes, you get dirty working with it because of the dust but that is to be expected with equipment like the shredder. Running the leaves through once reduced the size of the leaves considerably but I found that running the leaves through twice resulted in the really small size mulch I wanted for the gardens.
customer_reviews.author: Betsy

customer_reviews.title: Wish the 'strings' held up better, but Maple leaves are tough stuff
customer_reviews.text: If you have leaves this is a must have. We typically take eighty-ninety 60gal bags of leaves off our yard every fall. Using this we now take 20-24 bags. Not quite the 4:1 they say, but very close. Its a real $$ saver in the cost of disposal. Next year the mulched leaves will be tilled into the new garden bed, eliminating the cost of disposal all together. Wish the 'strings' held up better, but Maple leaves are tough stuff. Strings last twice as long when shredding Ash and Willow leaves.
customer_reviews.author: G.W.

customer_reviews.title: Gets the Job Done
customer_reviews.text: This unit is a workhorse, although tends to clog up with moist leaves. It had rained on my pile of leaves the night before and had to change the line twice. Other than that, made easy work of a giant mount of leaves that filled 2 of those collapsable containers. Well worth the money! I used all the clippings for mulch around my shrubs and hydrangeas.
customer_reviews.author: G. Gonzalez

customer_reviews.title: Waste of money
customer_reviews.text: Good theory, works great for 1 bag of leaves then time to change the strings. I tried to like this thing, but I spent more time changing the lines than picking up leaves. I tried several weed eater lines and diameters. This thing chews the lines up to quickly. I was very careful about what I put into it as well. I used it one season and then delivered it to the local dump. I would not reccomend.
customer_reviews.author: Brian H.

customer_reviews.title: Small Yard Only!Or you are wasting time !
customer_reviews.text: This is for yards 1/8 of acre or smaller . We have 1/4 acre we tried to use this unit for the whole yard. It could not keep up .We used it on smaller piles still too time consuming for what was advertised . It did chop the leaves in small pieces but tried to use the rectangle bags ( which are biodigradble) could not fit correctly .More time wasted ! I wish I could return it but I think it is past the time . I will need to sell it ...
customer_reviews.author: kc aus

customer_reviews.title: Great low cost leaf mulcher
customer_reviews.text: The leaf shredder did a great job of mulching down my pile of leaves to get them into 2 cans. It is a bit noisy, but not awful. The dust that comes off the top while it’s grinding is brutal! Make sure to wear goggles and a quality mask or you won’t be able to breathe when you’re done. I was generally very pleased at the price and the load it was able to handle.
customer_reviews.author: Larry Aceves

customer_reviews.title: Quick Setup/Take Down
customer_reviews.text: This does a good job of mulching leaves so that you can either use it in beds or cut down on the number of bags needed to dispose of them. The thing I like best is the ability to put a plastic or paper bag under the unit to collect the mulch. It will collect 99% of the mulch as you dump in the leaves so cleanup is no big deal. I didn’t need to replace the line this season but the process looks very simple and based on my experience so far I’d say they provided enough replacement line to last for many years.
customer_reviews.author: texas guy

customer_reviews.title: Sure beats vaccuming up!!!
customer_reviews.text: This is a lot better than trying to vacuum leaves up. You do have to be a little careful not to over fill and it helps to shake it a bit to help them mulch up. Trimmer line tends to wear down quick, so I am looking for different options there, but for now it works great on dry leaves. Wet leaves tend to gum up a little more, but it works on those as well if fed in slow and clean the bin out periodically.
customer_reviews.author: Troy Wardle

customer_reviews.title: Made of plastic.
customer_reviews.text: The idea behind this machine is good. The design is good. The metal ring that is supported by metal legs, holds a trash bag very well. The unit sits on top very well. However, the spinning piece that holds the cutting strings is made of plastic and it melted when some debris got bound up around it. One and one half bag and it was done. Returning it for a refund. Good design but built out of plastic.
customer_reviews.author: Adventurebob

customer_reviews.title: Time Saver
customer_reviews.text: It does exactly what it says it will. It does a great job of mulching leaves directly into the bag. We only used a quarter of the bags we used last year, and finished in half the time. It nests down neatly for storage in our shed. The trimmer lines are easily replaced. The only drawback is the supplied ring to support the leaf bag. Doesn't work that well and should be redesigned.
customer_reviews.author: S Wolfe

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use, easy to store (machine and mulch)
customer_reviews.text: We used this for the first time this year to break down all the leaves. I want the mulch for my composter bin but wanted them to break down a little quicker. The machine worked nicely. Really does reduce the space leaves take up. I fit leaves off my back yard all in a 3X3X4 wire compost bin. The design is such, I can take it down and fit it all together the way it came in the box for storage. Very happy with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: BMDavis

customer_reviews.title: Worx like a champ!
customer_reviews.text: I’d been using a blower/vacuum unit before. While in vacuum mode the unit was heavy, back breaking and clumsy. I did my research and came upon the Worx Mulcher. I couldn’t have ask for a better product. Set up was easy. Clean up is easy and my leaf chore just became fun. This mulcher does all the work for you in no time. My neighbors are jealous. I’m proud! Love this product!
customer_reviews.author: anne

customer_reviews.title: Works very well
customer_reviews.text: I don't live in a deciduous forest, so I had what I thought from past experience might be about 20 garbage bags of leaves. This leaf mulcher reduced it to about 1 1/2 bags in probably around 30 minutes. It did require a little sorting out of thick twigs and branches, but if you do live in a deciduous forest, this might be great. In my case, I'll have to wait a year with it under a trap, to use it another 30 minutes. That doesn't detract from the fact that it worked fine for me.
customer_reviews.author: Charles H Carroll

customer_reviews.title: Mixed feelings
customer_reviews.text: I was so frustrated using this machine. It does shred leaves, but it threw them to the sides of the hopper and they stayed there and got all clogged up. I had to constantly stop it and shove the leaves thru the openings in the bottom. The directions said to use dry leaves, which they were (we've had warm, sunny days - no rain), but come on! It is Fall, it rains, the dew is really heavy and having completely dry leaves is nearly impossible. I actually considered using my lawnmower to shred the leaves like I used to do, but I wrecked my mower last fall doing that and didn't want to chance it again.
customer_reviews.author: BLB

customer_reviews.title: Shreds leaves.
customer_reviews.text: Been using this for weeks this fall. Shreds leaves for our compost heap and garden use. Watch for larger twigs and small branches as they will clog the feed and wear on the cutters. These are just plastic cord you would use on week eater. Easy to replace these. One bolt and you are done. I would buy this again. It is outside sitting next to a pile of leave right now.. waiting for me.
customer_reviews.author: Craig A. Martin

customer_reviews.title: Great unit for mulching fall leaves for compost
customer_reviews.text: There isn't too much I can complain about with this little unit. It chomps the leaves very nicely. It is a little clumsy moving it around but easy to get used to. It reduces large piles of leaves to literally in half in no time and I can't wait to see the compost next spring.
customer_reviews.author: suescrapper

customer_reviews.title: Very disappointing
customer_reviews.text: I was really disappointed with this product. The output wasn't substantially different than the input. It talks about a 10:1 reduction in volume; however, even under the most favorable circumstances (fluffy leaves with a lot of air gaps) I got 3:1 or 4:1. The product basically uses the same cord you would find on a weed wacker and they wear out way too quickly. I spent way too much of my time replacing the cords. It seemed to get bogged down way too easily, forcing me to carefully throttle the pace of feeding it. All these things combined I cannot recommend this product...unless you want to buy a used one cheap that is ;-)
customer_reviews.author: Vincent J Kenkel

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: Works as advertised. Truly a great time saver. Typically, I use about 40 large bags to collect all the leaves from the ground and three days to do them. Using this mulched, I only used 15 bags and did it all in one full day. The only minor issue I have is the nylon string does not last very long. I may need to modify to allow a thicker nylon to increase usage.
customer_reviews.author: Alex C

customer_reviews.title: Cannot mulch damp or wet leaves
customer_reviews.text: This thing works great if what you are mulching is 100% completely dry. Anything wet causes it to jam up. Fall in New England is too unpredictable and never 100% dry. I had hoped it would work out better than it did and had to return it as I still had to bag 20 bags of slightly damp leaves.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Love this!
customer_reviews.text: This machine is great! Couldn't believe that it reduced an entire yard of leaves down to two paper yard bags. It's a bit noisy but nothing you can't handle. The only problem I have with it is getting the paper yard bag adjusted with the orange belt that comes with it.
customer_reviews.author: M. Ruberto

customer_reviews.title: Excellent experience
customer_reviews.text: I wasn't sure what to expect as I'd never used a leaf mulcher before but with our volume of leaves and a desire to not spend the money on wood mulch, I thought I'd give this a try. Easy to assemble and easy to use. I put a before and after photos of part of our yard - you can see the volume of leaves to shred and then the end result. This took about 45 minutes to shred, spread, and move and reset the machine as needed. I'm very pleased with this.
customer_reviews.author: M Davis

customer_reviews.title: Mulch on
customer_reviews.text: This mulcher worked brilliantly. At first I was a little concerned about it breaking, as many reviews stated if twigs went through it, but as long as they were small, no problem. I would highly recommend it. The only negative would be it is a little heavy. It would be great to add wheels to make it easier to move from place to place.
customer_reviews.author: elizabeth hendrix

customer_reviews.title: Fall yard work made easy!
customer_reviews.text: 14 TALL oaks and elm trees on 1/4 acare. Worked great. Leaves were not even all that dry and it tore em up. Lot of line replacement needed, but easy to install. Buy replacment line ahead of time. Would recommend this to anyone that has a lot of fall clean up and bagging to do. A+ P.S. also bought the worx pop up yard bag, fits underneath and makes clean up easier.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Practical and Effective
customer_reviews.text: Assembly was quick and easy. Two cautionary notes: 1.) Mulching wet leaves is very time consuming and wasteful. Best to mulch when semi-dry or dry for best results. 2.) The replacement cords are easy to replace, however be warned that they will need to be replace fairly frequently. I filled around 14 bags of and needed to replace them half way through and will need to replace them before doing anymore. All together, I definitely see value in this purchase and would recommend to others.
customer_reviews.author: Patrick

customer_reviews.title: Buy the pop up bag!
customer_reviews.text: I have owned this for a couple years and it works great. But the Home Depot yard bags do not work well with it. Buy the brown canvas pop up accessory they show. It catches everything and is easy to empty into a yard waste bag. Absolutely worth the money!
customer_reviews.author: R. Speizer

customer_reviews.title: Pulverizes the leaves real well. Have to change the whip often
customer_reviews.text: I like the product and it met my expectations. The only downside to it is that you have to continuously change out the little whip. Other people's reviews have provided suggestions on ways to get more durable whips in there and they may try that next season. That said it really does a good job of pulverizing the leaves and overall consider this a good purchase
customer_reviews.author: Robert J Matulis

customer_reviews.title: Easy & quick. ❤️😀
customer_reviews.text: ❤️❤️❤️ I am not handy & I can break things by just standing nearby & I tend to get hurt during any task but this leaf shredder is a dream. Easy to assemble. Works fast. No part of shredding requires my hands to be near the cutting area. I LOVE IT!
customer_reviews.author: Picky Texan

customer_reviews.title: Running them over with the lawn mower was not a good option. This item mulches the leaves uniformly and ...
customer_reviews.text: 4 large maple trees drop more leaves than can be counted. Running them over with the lawn mower was not a good option. This item mulches the leaves uniformly and is very fast. The occasional small stick does no harm and is barely noticed. I fill my compost pile with almost more mulch than I can use. It is well constructed and very stable. It is easy to set up and use. The only thing not mentioned in the description is my son no longer complains how hard the fall leaf pick up is.
customer_reviews.author: mcdtc

customer_reviews.title: Great for shredding leaves for mulch/compost
customer_reviews.text: Works very well to shred leaves and handles small twigs. I would not put anything approaching/larger than finger diameter. However, those little annoying twigs will get chopped a little. The only drawback is the intake sometimes gets masked with leaves or shredded leaves - I'll be fashioning a cover that still lets it breath. When the intake is clogged the leaves don't feed well. I've shredded enough leaves to fill 15 32 gal trash bags and only changed strings twice. A few large twigs (and I'm sure a few acorns) have gotten in so that probably shortened the string life.
customer_reviews.author: DanburyBowhunter

customer_reviews.title: I love this thing
customer_reviews.text: Works great if you do not get sticks in there then will clog often. You must wear googles when using this. Stuff does fly all over the place. Really does save you a lot of money on leaf bags. I bought 100 last year - this year I will get away with 20. The 11:1 ratio is probably right but I would say 6 or 7 to 1 bag because you still need to lift them. Changing nylon line is very, very simple. If you have a lot of trees - this is really good.
customer_reviews.author: BW

customer_reviews.title: Effective and incredible!
customer_reviews.text: I have lots of trees on my property, and this time of year they all shed their leaves like it's the cool thing to do. This guy mulched up a pile of leaves 6 feet tall, 35 feet long, and 8 feet deep into about a dozen 30 gallon trash bags. It doesn't seem to make any sense, but it reduces the volume enormously. Yes, it is a ton of work to bend and lift all of the piles of leaves, but it's incredibly helpful in reducing the amount of leaves you're bagging.
customer_reviews.author: Mike Jandreau

customer_reviews.title: No damp leaves allowed
customer_reviews.text: The leaves you put in this machine can not be even the slightest bit damp or else it clogs the entire unit up. I live in the Pacific Northwest and found that even with the leaves being fairly dry they still jammed up the unit so I had to return it.
customer_reviews.author: Jordan

customer_reviews.title: Does a great job reducing leaves to smaller sizes
customer_reviews.text: Great for leaves, not so great if you have small branches mixed in with the leaves... best to sort them out first. This will increase the life of the 2 strings that do the cutting. They are easily replaced with a small pair of needle-nose pliers. You should wear a face mask while using this unit, because it does tend to throw a lot of dust around. It is also a bit noisy, but that is to be expected.
customer_reviews.author: Richard H. Kandt, Jr.

customer_reviews.title: Decent product
customer_reviews.text: I have had this product for a couple years now and it mulches the leaves pretty good. It's basically a weed-eater in a bucket, but it's handy when dealing with a ton of leaves. I can condense straight into a leaf bag or trash can, which is useful. I don't expect it to properly mulch sticks, wet leaves, or any other such items, nor do I expect it to properly mulch by over cramming it.
customer_reviews.author: Alia

customer_reviews.title: It Worx
customer_reviews.text: Does the job but it’s dirty and loud....not complaining but it’s a “need to know”. Also, the mulched leaves will definitely meet the 11:1 ratio but that makes for one heavy bag of leaves. My only complaint is that the trimming line gets chewed up fast by sticks. You’ll get a good bundle of line in the box but it won’t last long if you have a lot of sticks. I’m not sure is the answer for my needs but I’m also on wooded 3/4 acre lot.
customer_reviews.author: Ray

customer_reviews.title: Difficulty using this machine due to other debris
customer_reviews.text: We live on a mountain with many trees that shed leaves. This leaf grinder did not work well because of the other debris that gets into the leaf pile such as pine cones and bark. If we only had leaves it would probably work well
customer_reviews.author: Kori Pilkington

customer_reviews.title: I do love this. I have a lot of leaves but ...
customer_reviews.text: I do love this. I have a lot of leaves but didn't want another complicated piece of machinery... This is easy for me...and I do it as the leaves come... and I run the leaves through twice..Aspen leaves.. Follow that Drunken Compost method off Youtube and these leaves are the best soil in a week... Wish I had this years ago. The string has to be changed like a weed whacker.. but so easy and you can buy stronger string....It's light weight so it will take extra care...make sure it's clean when you finish. I'm over 60 and can't lift a lot so for me...perfect...
customer_reviews.author: Mountain Happy

customer_reviews.title: Great shredder
customer_reviews.text: This thing works great for leafs! Don't forget that just because it shreds the leafs up where you can fit more in one bag, that the bag won't be any heavier. If you shred three bags worth if leafs into one bag, that bag will be as heavy as three bags.
customer_reviews.author: Sam

product_meta.title: WORX WG430 13 Amp Foldable Bladeless Electric Leaf Mulcher, Red
product_meta.description:
Style:13 Amp Bladeless Electric Leaf MulcherTurn 11 bags of leaves and debris into 1 with the 13.0 Amp Electric Leaf Mulcher. A whole afternoon’s worth of work can be chopped down into a manageable load, instead of dragging a dozen+ bags to the curb. This tool features a clean air motor cooling system, enabling it to run at peak efficiency, and keep mulching up to 53 gallons of leaves per minute. Its 13” cutting diameter is supported by an easy to change string system, so you’ll always have sharp line. Easy to use, easy to maintain, easy to store, its lawn clearing made easy.

AMAZON.COM
The WORX WG430 Leaf Mulcher is the all-in-one solution to an annual problem: piles and piles of leaves in the yard. It smartly disposes of heaps of leafy yard waste in a few simple steps, turning hundreds of gallons of rotting leaves into vitamin-rich, organic mulch that's a perfect fertilizer for your flowerbed or garden. The WORX Flex-a-Line bladeless mulching system uses normal, heavy-duty grass trimmer line instead of dangerous metal blades to easily and safely mulch through leaves and debris.




The WORX WG430
Leaf Mulcher
At a Glance: * Powerful 13 Amp motor generates 8,500 RPM
 * Easy, tool-free assembly
 * Mulches up to 53 gallons of leaves per minute
 * Ultra compact for storage
 * Disposes of leaves and debris straight into bags
 * Ideal source of fertilizer
 * Dust-reducing, clean-air motor cooling system


Mulcher components nest for easy storage.
View larger.
Universal bag holder enables one-step mulching and disposal.
Click for more features.
Reduce dust and exhaust with patented clean-air cooling system. View larger.A Lean, Green, Mulching Machine
Shredding leaves with a traditional gas shredder/mulcher can disturb the environment with noxious air and loud noise. Thankfully, with the electric WORX Leaf Mulcher, you can put the 'green' back in 'green thumb'.Showcasing a powerful 13 Amp motor that delivers 8,500 RPMs, the WORX Leaf Mulcher will reduce a mass of dead leaves and twigs to 1/11th of its original size. That means you won't be lugging 11 bags of whole leaves to the curb for distribution or disposal--instead, you'll only have to worry about a single bag.

With the WORX Leaf Mulcher's 13-inch cut diameter and oversized mouth, you can mulch up to 53 gallons of leaves per minute. Acres of dried leaves can be collected and pulverized into manageable mounds of mulch in practically no time at all.

Create Mulch and Compost
It is estimated that almost 25% of the urban waste stream is made of yard waste and debris. In the fall, it can account for more than 60% of what flows into your local landfill.

The WORX Leaf Mulcher actually transforms your yard's dead leaves and debris, which would normally end up in a landfill, into vitamin-rich mulch and compost that can be recycled into your garden or flowerbeds.

Shredded leaf mass furnishes nutrients that assist in new plant growth during the growing season. Furthermore, mixing mulch into your garden and flower beds will aerate the soil and encourage new growth. Additionally, leaf mulch will increase water retention in the soil, reducing watering time and saving money.

Compact, Versatile, and Easy to Use
At less than 20 pounds, the WORX Leaf Mulcher features a compact design, in which the disassembled parts nest neatly together for convenient off-season storage on a shelf in your shed or garage. Setup takes only a few minutes, with absolutely no additional tools required!

In addition, the mulcher features a dust-reducing clean-air motor cooling system. Air and mulched leaves are separated through an external cooling air intake and exhaust to significantly reduce dust generation.

For further convenience, The WORX Leaf Mulcher's safe Flex-a-Line bladeless mulching system features tool-less cutting line replacement and a universal bag holder that accepts both paper and plastic bags. To top it off, an oversized on/off switch allows for easy, hassle-free operation.

The WORX heavy-duty Leaf Mulcher is the one machine that will end hours of misery once and for all and will make fall cleanup fast and easy!

What's in the Box
WORX WG430 Leaf Mulcher, 24 replacement lines, and one universal bag holder.




Tool-free locking system enables easy assembly and storage.


FROM THE MANUFACTURER
The new Worx leaf mulcher makes collecting leaves easier, quicker and leaves your yard tidier. By simply dropping your leaves into the large feed hole they are mulched to 1/11th their size and drop right into a bag you fit under the unit. Its unique design accepts both plastic and paper bags and delivers an exceptional high mulch efficiency rate of 53 gallons/minute. This is achieved with the safe flex-a-line bladeless mulching system, offering the added benefit of tool-less cutting line replacement. Assembly is also tool-less and coupled with its compact design allows for convenient, easy off-season storage in your garage or shed. The design incorporates a dust reducing clean air motor cooling system and an oversized on/off switch for ease of use. The 13 amp motor delivers 8500 rpm and accommodates a 13-Inch cut diameter all in a package that weighs only 20 lbs. The WG430 comes with 24 replacement lines and 1 universal bag holder.
